result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas D. Gilson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Second or Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
**3 days credit, if revoked** 

If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes: PAYABLE DIRECTLY TO AND COLLECTED BY EAU CLAIRE COUNTY CLERK OF COURT.  NOT A CONDITION OF PROBATION.
AODA and follow through with recommendations.

Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications or possess any drug paraphernalia.

Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas D. Gilson

records.descr: Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt: Reminder Notice indicating amount due mailed to defendant.

(Case called at 3:16 PM) Defendant Thomas D. Gilson in court, in custody with Attorney Erika Amundson. Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense recites the joint sentence recommendation. Defendant pleads No Contest to Possession of Narcotic Drugs as Second or Subsequent Offense without Repeater. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Discussion held regarding probation location. Court accepts plea and finds the Defendant guilty. 
Court withholds sentence and orders 2 years Probation with the following conditions: AODA and follow through with recommendations. Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place Where alcohol is primarily served/sold. Defendant not to consume/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications or possess any drug paraphernalia. Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. Maintain absolute sobriety. Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. Court costs. 
Court orders 3 days credit, if revoked.
Plea hearing on September 12, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

10:11 AM case called. Prosecuting Attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Thomas D. Gilson in court with Attorney Erika Amundson. Agreement has been reached. Attorney Amundson requests time to speak to Defendant.

10:18 AM case recalled. Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. Branch 3 for scheduling Arraignment.

9:46 AM case called. Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Thomas D. Gilson not in court.  Attorney Erika Amundson in court for Thomas D. Gilson. 
Court advises if defendant does not appear at next hearing, a warrant will be ordered.
Hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant waives formal reading of the complaint and time limits for preliminary hearing.
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on June 6, 2022 at 3:15 pm.
